qas.question: What musical instrument is situated at Royal Albert Hall?
London-based EMI is a corporation focused on what industry?
In which facility is the London Symphony Orchestra based?
What are the names of London's two primary opera houses?

answers.text: the Royal Opera House and the London Coliseum

qas.question: Royal Academy of Music and Royal College of Music are examples of what?

context: London is one of the major classical and popular music capitals of the world and is home to major <a1_0>music<a1_0/> corporations, such as EMI and Warner Music Group as well as countless bands, musicians and industry professionals. The city is also home to many orchestras and concert halls, such as <a2_0>the Barbican Arts Centre<a2_0/> (principal base of the London Symphony Orchestra and the London Symphony Chorus), Cadogan Hall (Royal Philharmonic Orchestra) and the Royal Albert Hall (The Proms). London's two main opera houses are <a3_0>the Royal Opera House and the London Coliseum<a3_0/>. <a0_0>The UK's largest pipe organ<a0_0/> is at the Royal Albert Hall. Other significant instruments are at the cathedrals and major churches. Several <a4_0>conservatoires<a4_0/> are within the city: Royal Academy of Music, Royal College of Music, Guildhall School of Music and Drama and Trinity Laban.
